title: Business Analyst within eHealth
description:
*Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in eHealth with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our eHealth solutions support healthcare professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish health and social care. We are growing continuously and now have about 1000 employees in several countries.*

 **The position**  

As a Business Analyst, you will be a part of an agile development team including developers and testers. You will also collaborate closely with product owner(s), other business analysts, informaticians, and architects. You will investigate and analyze needs, detail requirements, and design solutions for one of Sweden’s leading healthcare journal system. You are an important link between the developers and the customer, with the mission to understand the needs of our end users and translate them into technical solutions. You often get to follow an initiative all the way from pre-study to development and implementation at the customer's premises. As part of our team, you will do meaningful work where you help to improve and digitize healthcare processes.


We are currently looking for several Business Analysts who will be working with one of our areas such as e.g. Care documentation, Care plans, Patient administration, Regulatory requirements, Speech recognition and Digital dictation. You will be working with creating both functional and non-functional requirements.


At Cambio, we encourage taking initiatives that contribute to the development of the company and ourselves. For us, it is important that you should have the opportunity to grow, both as a person and as an employee. Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeate everything we do.  

  

**About you**  

You work independently and with your own drive, but also thrive when you get the opportunity to collaborate with your teammates, other Business Analysts, as well as other roles across the organization. You like to meet our customers, partners and eHealth organizations and are passionate about finding the best solutions. We believe that you are analytical, well-structured and with strong cooperation skills.

**Requirements**

* >3 years of working with business analysis, requirement analysis, product design or similar.
* Great knowledge in how business needs can be translated into software requirements.
* Great ability to collaborate with product owner(s), architects, system developers and UX designers.
* Communicates fluently in English and Swedish

 **It's a bonus if you**

* Experience of health informatics, and/or integration work (e.g. API design).
* Knowledge of healthcare standards and specifications (FHIR, HL7v2, RIVTA, OpenEHR, SNOMED CT)
* Previously have worked within healthcare
* Highly meritorious with experience of COSMIC and related integration solutions
* Experience in working with agile software development
* Experience in UX design

 **Place of employment**: Linköping or Stockholm


At Cambio we value a healthy work-life balance, and to encourage that we apply a hybrid working-model. Together with your team you decide which days you work at the office. On the remaining days you can work remotely from home, but you are always more than welcome to work at the office too.

**Scope**: Full time

**Form of employment:** Permanent employment, 6 months trial period

**Other:** We screen the applications and hold interviews continuously so please send your application as soon as possible via the link.


We encourage and eagerly welcome all applications, but we will only consider candidates who are located and have the legal right to work in **Sweden.** We will ask for verification during the process.

**We look forward to receiving your application!**


Read more about us **here!**


Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at the career site **here!**

title: Senior Backend Software Engineer - Stockholm
description:
**About Brite**


Brite Payments is a leading Open Banking-powered Account to Account (A2A) payment provider of Instant Payments and Instant Payouts. We provide a convenient transaction experience for consumers and reduce the risk in the payment process for merchants. Founded in Stockholm in 2019, Brite is committed to providing the best possible payment solution for everyone involved in a transaction.


The team behind Brite has worked with launching the first-generation of fintech companies before founding Brite. We know the market landscape, technologies, opportunities, and challenges. Now we channel all those experiences into developing modern solutions that will benefit both merchants and end-users.


Want to join us on our journey? The future is brite!

**What you will do**


As a Senior Software Engineer at Brite you will work with our core team of highly skilled developers. Your tasks will be to develop and build a scalable and future-proof framework. You will work on building components to bridge between us and the banks across Europe, in order to deliver authentication (AIS) and payment initiation (PIS). As a Developer at Brite, you will have a major impact on building the foundation of our core platform. With that said, you will be a vital part of the next fintech unicorn!

**Are you a brite mind?**

* Experience in systems development in Python, GO and Angular
* Experience with Cloud Computing (Google cloud)
* At least 3 years of developer work experience

**Meriting experience:**

* AWS, Azure
* Kubernetes
* Microservice architecture

**Preferred skills:**

* A degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience
* Experience from building scalable, service-oriented architectures
* Experience from working with transaction-intensive systems
* Experience with Docker
* Experience with Javascript/Typescript
* Experience with information security from a systems development perspective (OWASP, encryption, etc.)

**What we offer**

* An optimistic, caring, and inclusive culture where we want you to be yourself
* A dynamic, fast-paced, and innovative environment where you will have the possibility to make an impact from your first day onwards.
* A flat organization, friendly colleagues, and fast decision-making
* An environment where we start small and learn fast to do big things
* A team that cares about sharing, collaborative work, and prestigeless approach
* A yearly wellness allowance and Tuesday breakfasts at the office
* ... and you will be part of a growing team of fun and skilled people

title: Senior Full-Stack Developer | Shared Tech
description:
Available in 3 locations
Category
Technology & Development
Job ID
R023334

Regular**Description**
---------------

**Craft:**


Technology & Development**Job Description:**

**Senior Full Stack Developer - Game Operations Platform**
==========================================================


We are looking for a versatile full stack developer to shape the future of King’s Game Operations Platform where teams build applications to monitor, grow and monetize some of the most popular mobile games in the world such as Candy Crush Saga! The platform contains a suite of software products designed to provide a central, high-quality, robust and extensible toolset with a consistent and stable user experience.


The Game Operations Platform team aims to provide a competitive technical ecosystem that allows internal teams to easily build applications and deliver to the platform without worrying about the infrastructure.

**Your role within our Kingdom:**
As a member of the Game Operations Platform team, you will play an important role to influence how technology evolves at King and how King teams develop their internal applications that bring great value to our games. You will work closely with your teammates in an agile environment and you will do product discovery, pair/mob programming and code reviews in GitHub. As a platform developer, you will engage in cross-team collaboration and assist other teams in building applications within our platform.

**Your responsibilities might include:*** Develop and maintain King internal tech stack including frontend and backend libraries, frameworks and core APIs
* Improve developer experience, such as self-service tooling, that allow King teams to create and manage their applications
* Develop new features that enhance the experience of our end-users who use the platform to monitor and operate king games
* Co-develop internal applications and libraries with other teams
* Research and drive technology innovations across teams
* Showcasing our work in multiple forums such as presenting in demos, mentoring and coaching other developers through tech workshops and onboarding

**Skills to create thrills:*** Good experience with React and other frontend frameworks/libraries
* Good experience working with backend services using Java or similar
* Good understanding of RESTful APIs and/or RPC APIs
* Familiar with testing frameworks
* A desire to learn new technologies and programming languages across the stack

**Bonus points:*** Knowledge of app development using cloud technologies in GCP or similar
* Enjoys working in a dev-ops culture

**About King**


At King, we’re Making the World Playful. Heard of Candy Crush? We’re the creators behind it. With game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles, and Malta, we have a 20-year history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry and are on a mission to level-up the little moments for our more than 200 million active monthly users. But we aren’t just crushing it with candies, we’re also behind Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch, Pet Rescue and loads of other sweet games. As a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, King is part of Activision Blizzard, which was recently acquired by Microsoft.

**A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes**


King strives to be a place where everyone can be their most authentic self. We recognize that diversity, equity and inclusion is a vital and continuous conversation, and that change only happens when we all come together. It’s our mission to build a diverse and inclusive Kingdom for our people, players, and community.

**Making the World Playful**


Making the World Playful is our mission – it’s the thread that connects our people, our players, and our passion for our games. Let’s face it, who doesn’t love a bit of fun?


Kingsters are seriously playful: creative thinkers who balance art and science to bring moments of magic to millions daily. But our players aren’t the only ones that can level-up. We’re always looking for ways to champion each other and make what’s already great, even better.


So, if this feels like a fun way to spend your days, and you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful.


Applications need to be in English.  

Discover King at careers.king.com
company_description: Making the World Playful is our mission – it’s the thread that connects our people, our players and our passion for our games. Let’s face it, who doesn’t love a bit of fun?

title: Junior SEM Specialist
description:
**Junior SEM Specialist**
=========================


Triggerfish & Awave blir ett och vi söker vår nästa SEM specialist. Hos oss får du jobba med drivna team med det gemensamma målet att jobba med spännande kunder och ha roligt under tiden.



Ett projekt är aldrig det andra likt hos oss. Som SEM specialist hos oss på en etablerad och proaktiv byrå finns alltid en spännande utmaning med drivna kollegor och kunder att samarbeta med! Hos oss jobbar man för Triggerfish och Awave – två byråer som går samman och ingår i det internationella byrånätverket iO. Du blir en del av ett inspirerande, prestigelöst, stöttande och kompetent team på 85 medarbetare med projektledare, utvecklare, designers och digitala marknadsförare.



Vi jobbar med allt från utveckling och design till digital marknadsföring och inget är omöjligt för oss när det kommer till att digitalisera och affärsutveckla åt våra kunder. Många av våra kunder har vi jobbat med under väldigt lång tid och för oss är det viktigaste att bygga långsiktiga, roliga och hjärtliga relationer till våra kunder. Vi vill vara deras förlängda arm inom den digitala plattformen.


**Det här innebär jobbet**
--------------------------


Du kommer att få jobba med en mängd spännande projekt både i och utanför Sverige. Det läggs stor vikt vid eget driv och ett brinnande intresse för att se affären i våra kunder. Du får möjlighet till stort eget ansvar och att arbeta både självständigt och i team. Ytterst kommer du att stötta vår seniora SEM-strateg med att hantera uppdrag i konton såsom att bygga nya kampanjer och driva pågående optimering.



Vårt breda register av både större och mindre kunder, projekt både i Sverige och internationellt, ger dig möjlighet att utvecklas i din roll som SEM-specialist. Vi är ett bolag med fötterna på jorden där det finns utrymme att ta stort ansvar och växa i den riktning en vill. Hos oss är det högt i tak och tillsammans bygger vi och utvecklar företaget.


**Det här är (nog) du**
-----------------------


Vi ser att du har minst två års av arbete inom SEM. Du är en fena på att självständigt sätta upp sökordsanalyser via Ahrefs, och sökkampanjer efter best practise. Du kan också förstå och analysera mätvärden i Google Ads för ditt beslutsunderlag och därmed kunna gå in och optimera vid behov.



Du har god teknisk förståelse och tycker om att arbeta i en rörlig och snabb produktion där kvalitet är A och O. Du är noggrann och proaktiv, strukturerad, kommunikativ och orädd med god analytisk förmåga. Kunden, tekniken och idéer är det du brinner för. Du är en person som vill lära dig nytt och utvecklas och som ser möjligheterna.



Du är inte rädd för att vara tydlig och är en god kommunikatör. Du är en lagspelare som drivs av att skapa de bästa lösningarna tillsammans i grupp. Du är ödmjuk och pedagogisk och trivs i en våga-fråga kultur med högt i tak.


### **Krav som tar dig ett steg närmare jobbet**


Har ett stort* och är orädd och nyfiken.
* Arbetat minst två år med SEM (Google Ads).
* Tidigare jobbat på webb-, reklam-, digitalbyrå, konsultbolag eller motsvarande.
* Gärna erfarenhet av Google shopping och YouTube.
* Älskar att skapa kundrelationer och att hela tiden vara steget före.
* Brinner för kvalitet.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift.
### **Sånt vi gillar att du har erfarenhet av**


* Försäljning, exempelvis nykundsbearbetning och upphandlingar.
* Google Tag Manager och Google Analytics.
* Utbildning inom projektmetodik så som scrum eller andra agila arbetssätt.
* Vana att arbeta i en ISO certifierad organisation.
* Förkärlek för form och design.

title: AI Sales Specialist, Google Cloud
description:
### **Minimum qualifications:**

* Experience identifying and driving use cases to solve customer issues.
* Experience partnering with technical staff to build business cases and implementation plans.
* Experience promoting IT business solutions and executing a territory sales strategy.

  

### **Preferred qualifications:**

* Experience working with and managing partners in complex implementation projects, including global system integrators and packaged software vendors.
* Experience in promoting the AI technology stack.
* Experience working with product teams and an understanding of how to embed technology into the product set.
* Familiarity with Google Cloud and Google Cloud AI offerings.
* Ability to connect AI/ML with business value and engage executive stakeholders as an advisor and thought leader.
* Ability to drive business growth across a broad set of industry-specific AI/ML use cases.

**About the job**
-----------------


As an AI Sales Specialist Specialist, you will be responsible for growing our AI business by building and expanding relationships with new and existing customers. You will develop relationships with external customer stakeholders, identifying innovative ways to multiply the impact of the team. You will partner with internal Google Cloud Platform (GCP) Sales teams to grow their AI businesses and drive overall value for GCP.

  

Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Calibrate the business against the objectives and key results. Forecast and report the state of the business for the territory.
* Build and maintain executive relationships with customers as the AI Subject Matter Expert, influence long-term strategic direction for the new and existing customers as well as the Google Cloud Field Sales Representatives (FSRs) and Customer Engineers (CEs).
* Assist customers in identifying AI use cases suitable for Google Cloud AI products and solutions. Articulate key solution differentiators and the measurable business impact.
* Develop and execute strategic account plans, including a broader enterprise plan across key verticals.
* Work with Google Account and Technical teams to develop and drive pipelines, and provide expertise. Execute Go-To-Market (GTM) business plays and related efforts with the Cloud teams and GCP partners.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. title: Product Designer
description:
If you are passionate about the hospitality industry and excited to reshape the digital customer journey experience, then this is the perfect opportunity for you! We are on the lookout for a creative and driven **Product Designer** to join our team and take our guest obsession to the next level.  

  

At Strawberry, we're on a quest to redefine the hospitality experience through innovation, technology, and a deep commitment to our guests. We find ourselves at an exhilarating juncture in our journey. Our ambition? To position Strawberry as the catalyst for a unique opportunity to explore and revolutionize the hospitality industry.



What you will be doing:



As a Product Designer, your primary goal is to craft the best user experience for our guests at Nordic Hotels & Resorts, the largest portfolio of independent hotels in the Nordics! At Strawberry, we are constantly striving to enhance every step of our guests' journey—from exploring our services and making reservations to their stay and post-stay experiences. You will collaborate closely with stakeholders to understand business requirements and user needs.



As part of the design team, you will manage the entire design process, from initial exploration to user research, concept development, user testing, and delivering high-end UI design ready for implementation by developers. Adapting the design process to meet stakeholder needs and project timelines is crucial. You'll employ a user-centered approach, creating prototypes and wireframes, iterating design solutions rapidly, and conducting usability testing to ensure the best outcomes.



Who we think you are:



We believe you have experience in UX and UI design, with a solid understanding of various design methodologies and the wisdom to know when to use which. You should be experienced in conducting research and testing, producing UI, and collaborating closely with product owners, other designers, and developers throughout the development process. Proficiency in Figma and maintaining a design system is essential.



You likely hold a degree in UX, interactive design, or a related field and have thrived in a fast-paced business environment where taking initiative is key. As a great team player, you enjoy inspiring and having fun with your colleagues. Strong communication skills are vital for collaborating with stakeholders in a rapidly changing environment. You challenge common perceptions of our guests' experiences and discuss design solutions enthusiastically.



Detail-oriented and a critical thinker, you approach problems with a positive, can-do attitude. You have a knack for problem-solving and logical thinking, always keeping an eye on the next innovation and the latest trends.



What we can offer you:


* A flat organization with trust and autonomy in your work. We are rebels that support innovation without imposing strict corporate rules.
* The chance to be part of a passionate team with exceptional colleagues and an inclusive culture, that believes every stay should be a story worth telling.
* Plenty of social events including smaller gatherings with your team and huge get-togethers with the whole Strawberry family!
* Great benefits! In addition to our collective agreement, we also offer staff discounts and friends & family rates at our 200+ hotels.


**About Nordic Hotels & Resort**



Nordic Hotels & Resorts is part of Strawberry Hospitality Group, and consists of a total of 42 hotels and restaurants, and we continue to grow. Common to all our hotels is that we offer guests new, extraordinary hotel experiences. Always out of the ordinary.



Sounds interesting?



Great, because we would love to get to know you too! Interviews will be held on a rolling basis, don’t wait to submit your application! We are looking for people who are currently residing in Sweden mainly in the Stockholm area.
company_description: We are Strawberry. With over 225 hotels, 120 restaurants, 20 spas and more, we create thousands of experiences every day. Join a world of experiences!

title: Associate Software Engineer
description:
#### **Location**

Sweden, Stockholm
#### **Apply by**

2024-06-30
At Strawberry, we're on a quest to redefine the hospitality experience through innovation & technology. In 2023 we launched our new mother brand, Strawberry, and we are transforming from a traditional hotel company to a universe of offers and experiences for our guests and customers.



This new journey will result in many new and interesting development areas in the upcoming years and will be an opportunity to influence the company's future. We foster a culture where innovation is welcome, disruptive thinking is encouraged, and sharing ideas is constant. We’re ever-evolving, and we empower all of our associates to bring their individuality, potential, and personality to work.



We are now looking for our new **Associate Software Engineer** to join the Strawberry Tech team. You will be highly involved in driving quality work in the development to ensure that we deliver high-quality products to end-users and our developers alike.


**What you will be doing**
--------------------------



We are on an exciting journey to provide the best digital experiences to our customers, and we are seeking a talented Backend Java Developer to join our dynamic team. This role offers a unique opportunity to be at the forefront of innovation, where you will have the chance to architect, design, and implement robust backend solutions that power our cutting-edge applications running with cutting-edge technologies and cloud services. Additionally, you will engage in DevOps tasks, ensuring seamless integration and deployment processes that enhance our operational efficiency.



You will work in a cross-functional product team, alongside developers, designers, and everything in between. You will also work together with other java engineers and in the backend chapter initiative, contributing to the company-wide quality work.


**Who we think you are**
------------------------



We are looking for a junior software engineer with a great mindset. We believe that you are a driving force behind software quality who will help the team expand this area within Strawberry. You are full of initiative, and you have a great sense of agency, using your creativity to solve problems independently, of course with the help of your team!  

  



**Your colleagues would say you**
---------------------------------


* Design and implement RESTful APIs to support various business functionalities.
* Collaborate with frontend developers to integrate user-facing elements with server-side logic
* Constant learner on emerging technologies, trends, and best practices in backend development
* Are interested in learning more about cloud infrastructure, infrastructure as code and CI/CD pipelines
* Develop and execute unit tests, integration tests, and end-to-end tests to ensure code quality.
* Debug and resolve issues, bugs, and performance bottlenecks.
* Ensure the applications are running efficiently on the production environment through automated monitoring and alerting.
* Implement security best practices to protect applications from vulnerabilities and attacks.
* Provide ongoing support and maintenance for existing applications
* You don’t just write code; you help to design the overall solution
* Are sought after within your team for help in solving challenging problems
* Work in English with ease (it's our company language)

**What we can offer**
---------------------


* The opportunity to deliver direct impact and end-user value through modern technology.
* An organization that goes the extra mile, and cares about both people and the environment. Please see this link for more information. https://www.strawberryhotels.com/social-responsibility/
* Exceptional colleagues and an inclusive culture - we love to share and learn from each other.
* A flat organization with trust and autonomy in your work. We support innovation without imposing strict corporate rules.
* Brand new office integrated with one of our newly opened hotels right next to Mall of Scandinavia in Solna.
* There are plenty of perks of having an office at a hotel. These include a buffet breakfast and lunch available every day for a reduced fee (salary subsidy).
* Plenty of social events including smaller gatherings with your team and huge get-togethers with the whole Strawberry family.
* Great benefits. In addition to our collective agreement, we also offer staff discounts and friends & family rates at our 200+ hotels.

**Details:**
------------



You will be part of a team of fantastic colleagues and report to Avatar Singh Thakur, Engineering Manager for the backend team. The office is our primary work location, but we offer a hybrid working model for a more flexible working life. The HQ in Stockholm will be your base for this position.


**Sounds interesting?**
-----------------------



Great, because we would love to get to know you too! Bring your individuality and your potential, Strawberry welcomes all! Interviews will be held on a rolling basis, don’t wait to submit your application!


We are Strawberry. With over 225 hotels, 120 restaurants, 20 spas and more, we create thousands of experiences every day. With urban Comfort Hotel®, warm Quality Hotel™, stylish Clarion Hotel® and cosy Clarion Collection® Hotel and more than 40 unique independent hotels, our guests can pick and choose. Our team of 17 000 passionate individuals from more than 120 countries is what makes up our company – diversity is what makes us grow! Strawberry is built on our core values: energy, courage and enthusiasm.
company_description: We are Strawberry. With over 225 hotels, 120 restaurants, 20 spas and more, we create thousands of experiences every day. Join a world of experiences!

title: Systemutvecklare inom samhällsnyttan
description:
Jobbeskrivning


Är du en erfaren .NET- eller Java-utvecklare som brinner för att använda din expertis för att göra verklig skillnad? Då kan AFRY Digital Services vara rätt plats för dig! Vi söker nu fler passionerade seniora systemutvecklare till våra kunder inom offentlig sektor.


Vi har ramavtal med en rad myndigheter och organisationer inom offentlig sektor och söker nu konsulter för en rad spännande uppdrag. Hos oss får du möjlighet att:

* Arbeta med innovativa och samhällsnyttiga projekt. Vi har projekt hos bland annat Försvarets Materielverk, Arbetsförmedlingen och SL, och våra projekt spänner från att utveckla trafikinformationssystem till att effektivisera kliniska studier.
* Bli en del av ett team med starkt fokus på kompetensutveckling. Vi satsar stort på våra medarbetares utveckling och erbjuder regelbundna utbildningar och workshops.
* Få en flexibel och attraktiv arbetsmiljö. Vi har moderna kontor i Stockholm men vi erbjuder också möjlighet till hybridarbete.


Vi vill gärna träffa dig för att mer kunna specificera vilket uppdrag och kund som kan vara rätt för just dig! Om du är nyfiken på oss, och dina erfarenheter stämmer in på nedan kvalifikationer, är du varmt välkommen med din ansökan.


#systemutvecklare #java #.NET #AFRY #samhällsnytta


Kvalifikationer


Vi tror att du är en problemlösare som trivs i en kreativ och utmanande miljö, och att du tycker det är roligt att samarbeta med andra.


Om du även uppfyller nedan kvalifikationer tror vi att du kommer att passa bra in hos oss:

* Akademisk examen inom data/IT.
* Senior .NET- och/eller Java-utvecklare med minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Erfarenhet av olika molntekniker som Azure/AWS
* Professionella kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt.


Är du redo att bidra till samhällsnyttan? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Vi ser fram emot att lära känna dig!


Företagsbeskrivning


AFRY är en europeisk ledare inom ingenjörs-, design- och rådgivningstjänster med global räckvidd. Vi påskyndar omställningen mot ett hållbart samhälle. Vi är 19 000 hängivna experter inom infrastruktur, industri, energi och digitalisering, som skapar hållbara lösningar för kommande generationer.


Vår enhet Digital Services verkar över hela utvecklingskedjan med experter inom projektledning, kravanalys, QA och test, systemutveckling, arkitektur, dataanalys och AI, cybersäkerhet m.m.


Ytterligare information


VÅRT ERBJUDANDE


AFRY Digital Services erbjuder dig:

* En attraktiv arbetsmiljö med fokus på trivsel och utveckling. Du får utvecklas kontinuerligt genom individuella kompetensplaner och inspirerande workshops.
* Konkurrenskraftiga villkor med förmåner som friskvård, extra semester och generösa föräldraledighetsregler.
* Ett stort nätverk av kompetenta kollegor i Sverige och internationellt.


Varmt välkommen till oss!


KONTAKTPERSONER:

maria.strombrink@afry.com

rebecka.gravas@afry.com


OM REKRYTERINGSPROCESSEN  

Sista ansökningsdag är 2024-06-17. Urval görs löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan dess. Startdatum med hänsyn till eventuell uppsägningstid.


Vår rekryteringsprocess består av:

*AFRY is committed to creating an inclusive & diverse environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, disability, or age. You will be part of a global and diverse company where our differences are our strengths. Join us to accelerate the transition towards a sustainable society.*

*På AFRY driver vi förändring i allt vi gör. Vi anser att förändring sker när modiga idéer möts, när vi samarbetar, skapar innovation och omfamnar kreativa lösningar, det är så vi skapar framtiden. Vi söker konstant kvalificerade kandidater som vill ansluta sig till våra inkluderande team runt om i världen. Bli en del av oss och påskynda den gröna omställningen*

title: Tech Lead till förvaltnings- och utvecklingsteam inom Lån
description:
*Är du en rutinerad COBOL utvecklare med erfarenhet av att driva IT utveckling framåt inom mainframe och att ta fram arkitektoniska lösningar utifrån intressenters behov? Då har vi jobbet för dig!* **Om jobbet**
Du kommer ingå i, och tekniskt leda ett erfaret team bestående av både utvecklare och testare som tillsammans ansvarar för bankens lånesystem som ligger i mainframe. Systemet är mestadels skrivet i COBOL, men har även en del av sin kärna i assembler. Där tekniken rör sig mellan batch och externa API-anrop. Just nu pågår en spännande förflyttning och utveckling av systemet. Som du kan vara med och påverka!
Som Tech Lead ansvarar du för teamets arbete att designa, utveckla och förvalta effektiva och högkvalitativa IT-lösningar. Du är även systemets företrädare och ansvarar för att systemets framtida arkitektur återspeglar bankens strategiska IT mål. Framtagandet av arkitekturlösningar sker i nära samarbete med våra produktägare och seniora utvecklare.
I övrigt krävs engagemang, ett djupt intresse för teknik och eget ansvar. I arbetet ingår också regelbunden kontakt med såväl våra interna kunder/intressenter och andra förvaltnings- och driftteam. Vi förväntar oss att du är en aktiv deltagare när det gäller att förbättra vårt arbetssätt, våra metoder och verktyg. **Vem är du?**
För att trivas och lyckas i din roll hos oss är du kund- och affärsorienterad. Du har ledarskapserfarenhet och trivs med att arbeta i team. Du är engagerad och jobbar strukturerat med en god leveransförmåga. Du är positiv och tydlig i din kommunikation och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap. Du drivs av att ständigt utveckla dig själv och ditt sätt att arbeta.
Vi söker dig som har en gedigen erfarenhet inom COBOL-utveckling. Tycker du assembler är spännande så är det ett extra plus, men inget krav. Har du erfarenhet som arkitekt eller har ett öga för arkitektur är det meriterande, gärna inom mainframe. Vi vill dessutom att du har, som oss, ett stort intresse av att modernisera och att skapa framtidens mainframesystem!  

  

**Läs mer om hur det är att arbeta på SEB** **www.sebgroup.com/career**  

På SEB är vi övertygade om att inkludering och mångfald är avgörande för att kunna bygga starka och bra team och för att vårt företag ska vara hållbart för framtiden. Vi strävar efter att ha en inkluderande och värderingsdriven kultur där vi alla känner oss uppskattade, respekterade och involverade oavsett bakgrund, erfarenhet, tro, kön, ålder eller varifrån vi kommer. **Bra personer känner ofta bra personer – dela gärna annonsen om du har en vän som skulle älska det här jobbet** **Välkommen med din ansökan**
Bifoga ditt CV och ett personligt brev där du beskriver dig själv och vad du kan bidra med. Eftersom vi väljer ut kandidater löpande får du gärna skicka in din ansökan idag, men senaste datum för ansökan är den 2024-06-30.
company_description: More than 15.000 people work at SEB. Working in SEB means being part of an exciting journey, driven by digital transformation

title: Senior .NET-utvecklare
description:
Vi sökernågon som  

* Har minst fem års erfarenhet av .NET-utveckling
* Har minst fem års erfarenhet av Episerver / Optimizely
* Är genuint intresserad av tekniken och håller sig uppdaterade på det senaste
* Talar flytande svenska, eftersom det är vårt arbetsspråk

Extrameriterande  

* Erfarenhet av e-handel
* Lång erfarenhet och bevisat duktig på Episerver CMS / Optimizely Content Cloud
* Erfarenhet av Epi Commerce / Optimizely Commerce Cloud

Om tjänsten
Det fortsätter att vara hög efterfrågan på våra tjänster och vi utökar därför .NET-teamet med ytterligare en senior utvecklare med inriktning mot Optimizely/Episerver. Som utvecklare på IVEO arbetar du med varierande uppgifter i både större och mindre projekt, men generellt kan man säga att .NET/Optimizely-projekten tenderar att vara större snarare än mindre. Du är en del av alla faser inom projekten på .NET-sidan, både genom att jobba med de stora och komplicerade delarna men också genom att stötta kollegor med din erfarenhet. IVEO är Gold Partner till Optimizely och har i nuläget tre seniora utvecklare i Epi-teamet, som kommer att bli fler. Totalt består .NET-teamet i dagsläget av sex utvecklare.




Vi leder och driver projekten och tack vare mycket erfarna och tekniskt insatta projektledare elimineras de flesta vanliga vardagliga distraktionerna och du får mer effektiv tid till utveckling.


‍


Vi arbetar i små team i alla projekt och samtliga teammedlemmar har inflytande över beslut och utvecklingen. Du kommer ha riktigt bra möjligheter att lära dig av våra erfarna utvecklare, men vi hoppas förstås att du kan lära oss ett nytt trick eller två också. Om du som utvecklare vill lära dig något nytt försöker vi alltid hitta projekt som ger möjlighet till personlig utveckling och lärande. En av utvecklingsteamets största styrkor är att vi hela tiden jobbar med att hålla oss uppdaterade på den senaste tekniken och kontinuerligt jobbar med att hitta och använda de mest optimala verktygen för varje projekt. Om vi känner att något inte funkar för oss så bygger vi något eget, gör pull request till existerande projekt, eller hittar något annat verktyg som funkar bättre. Vi kör helt enkelt på den bästa lösningen.


‍


Vi har en hybridmodell där man kan jobba från kontoret eller hemifrån, men vill att man ska ha möjlighet att komma in till kontoret i alla fall ibland. Tjänsten är därför inte avsedd för permanent distansarbete från andra delar i landet, och heller inte för frilansare.


  
Egenskapervi gillar* Nyfikenhet och genuint intresse för teknik
* Viljan att göra och leverera *bra saker,* inte bara good enough
* Kunskap i kombination med prestigelöshet
* Ansvarstagande och öppen i kommunikation

Vad får duhos oss* Jobba med den senaste tekniken
* Hybridmodell som du vill, kontor eller på distans
* Jobba med innovativa projekt och några av Sveriges största företag
* Konkurrenskraftig lön och förmåner
* Labbdagar och konferenser
* Härliga kollegor runt lunchbordet, på kickoffer och after works
* Välfyllt kylskåp

Vi är inte den största byrån,men vi tror att vi är den bästa
IVEO är en mångsidig digital byrå med fokus på e-handel. Vi skapar inspirerande varumärkesupplevelser och läckra digitala lösningar. Med 15 års erfarenhet är vi en pålitlig och strategisk partner som har långsiktiga relationer med våra kunder.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
**This is Worldline**  


Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.  


**The Opportunity**  


Currently, we are looking for a versatile DevOps Engineer for our real-time card acquiring platform. In this position, you will be a valued member of a highly skilled and truly agile DevOps team, responsible for running and maintaining the business-critical services developed by the team – If you build it, you run it!  


**Day-to-Day Responsibilities**Our autonomous agile teams work in a strong DevOps culture. This means that you are responsible for:  


* Delivering on your team’s committed objectives including adapting to whatever is needed to reach the goal you and the team are committed to reach.
* Securing outstanding service availability and quality.
* Participate in your team’s day-to-day activities including software development, operations, application monitoring, maintenance and support in addition to being an active member in our agile events like daily stand-ups, planning meetings, retrospectives and demos etc.
* Collaborating with and helping developers in the team, for example by doing code reviews, participating in pair programming and by sharing your knowledge.

**Who Are We Looking For**  


We look for big thinkers. People who can drive positive change, step up and show what’s next – people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. In practice this means:  


* +3 years confirmed experience in software development. You know Python well enough to write applications for production use. You are comfortable working with relational databases (SQL). You are also comfortable working with version control (using Git, for example).
* Experience of working with Docker, preferably in Amazon ECS.
* Experience of developing microservices (preferably both server-based and serverless).
* Practical experience from working with Amazon Web Services, preferably with infrastructure-as-code via tools such as Terraform or CloudFormation. You are familiar with services such as S3, SQS, AWS Lambda, RDS and ECS.
* Experience from CI/CD production deployment using Jenkins pipelines (or similar).
* Experience of working with React is a plus.
* Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, engineering or another related field.
* A deep understanding of software quality assurance principles (and preferably experience in test automation).
* Full working proficiency in Swedish and/or English.

**Perks & Benefits**  


At Worldline you will get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:  


* Health contribution.
* Health check – Every 2nd year.
* Pension: BTP1 & BTP2.
* Private Health Care Insurance (Euro Accident).
* Parental pay and 12 months pension during parental leave.
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard.
* Benefit portal with many great offers, plus more.

**Shape the evolution**  


We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we are looking for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.  


**Learn more about life at Worldline at** jobs.worldline.com  


We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.
#LI-Hybrid
company_description: Worldline is the European leader in the payment and transactional services industry. With a presence in 40+ countries, Worldline employs more than 18,000 people. Empowering the cashless society.

title: Senior Service Now
description:
Job Description
Senior Service Now (Governance, Risk and Compliance) developers to support in replacement of old customized application with a new OOTB application.  

Location: Stockholm, Sweden  

Duration: 6 Months  

  

Candidate has to visit offer on demand.


Description: Bank is in the process of the implementation of a new Governance, Risk and Compliance (GRC) application in Service Now (IRM) which is according to OOTB and Industry standard in order to replace an old very customized Service Now GRC solution.  

Since we do not have enough development capacity for this in-house we need to hire consultants.  

We are looking for senior Service Now developers who have experience of development in the GRC application.  

We need support both in maintaining the old application and developing/implementing the new solution.

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

About Company
Axiom is a global information technology, consulting and outsourcing company and services provider. Our IT solutions empower organizations and individuals throughout the world to maximize value and quality to succeed in today's challenging business environment. As a fast-growing new economy company, we focus our strengths to offer world-class solutions and services through the convergence of technology, innovation, expertise and experience. We provide software consulting, development and IT-enabled services to clients across the globe. We work towards delivering sustained value creation for customers, employees, industries and society at large. Core offerings include data warehousing, middleware development, product development and web-enablement of legacy applications in verticals like telecom, finance, healthcare, manufacturing, energy & utilities, retail & distribution, enablement of legacy Relentless exploration of technology horizons and a Global Delivery Model that is a judicious combination of onsite, offsite and offshore development, offer a complete range of high-ROI business solutions spanning the consulting, technology, operations and process outsourcing value chain.


We are committed to providing solutions that are simple to use and cost-effective, that meet the specific set of needs defined, and that are adaptable to meet future needs.


Our aim is to work in partnership with our clients to deliver innovative and tailored solutions. Listening to and understanding your issues To deliver benefit—rapidly—to our clients. To create a unique customer focus, both in our relationships with our clients and in our approach. To use our world beating, innovative applications and methodologies to deliver high business value to our clients. Attaining senior level commitment to your project. Collaborative working and transparency. Building the right team for the job. Regular communication and documentation. Respecting the knowledge and experience of your staf.

title: Workflow Business Analyst within Financial Crime Prevention\u007C SEB, Stockholm
description:
The recently established Financial Crime Prevention (FCP) function will further accelerate SEBs deployment of advanced financial crime prevention capabilities to continuously meet regulatory expectations and to become a leader in fighting financial crime. The Financial Crime Prevention (FCP) function encompasses the areas of Fraud Prevention, AML transaction monitoring, sanctions, and customer screening. Fighting financial crime need to have an intelligence-led and data-driven approach where process automation will be core component of our FCP effort.

As we continue to evolve, we seek a dynamic and experienced professional to join our team as a Workflow Business Analyst.**What you will be doing**As a Workflow Business Analyst you will play a very important role in the process automation journey by being the essential link between the business and DEV teams and ensuring that business needs are met optimally and efficiently. Working together with Product stakeholders you will analyze business requirements and provide the best solutions for implementation. You will work in a diverse environment with teams and colleagues across international sites.  

In this position you will be responsible for:* Support business in defining the to-be process,
* Helping the business to understand technical capabilities, suggesting the best possible solutions, and explaining limitations,
* Collect business requirements and ensure the final product meets expectations,
* Providing work estimates and timely updates on solution analysis progress,
* Collaboration with business representatives, IT architects and other developers on defining the process implementation design,
* Analyzing and designing process solution ensuring it follows solution development best-practices,
* Preparing solution documentation,
* Collaboration with other teams on helping to resolve solution-based problems.

**Who we are looking for:*** Work experience with IBM BAW or any other product used for workflow automation would be an advantage,
* Experience in BPMN and process automation area would be an advantage,
* Work experience in an analytical role (IT area),
* Excellent in English (speaking and writing),
* Motivated, positive, and quick learner,
* Able to manage his/her time and prioritize,
* Up for a challenge and willing to take ownership,
* Experience with Agile/SAFe would be very good to have,
* Experience within Financial Crime Prevention is a plus.


**What we offer:*** Entrepreneurial Scandinavian environment,
* Friendly and welcoming culture,
* Long-term stability,
* Extensive training and learning opportunities,
* Work-life balance & hybrid way of working,
* Additional vacation and volunteering days,
* Comprehensive health insurance,
* Mobility within a large global company,
* Agile and modern ways of working.


**Application details**
Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to the Financial Crime Prevention unit. Candidates will be reviewed and selected on an ongoing basis, and you are welcome to submit your application as soon as possible, but no later than the 16th of June 2024.  

  

Should you have any questions regarding the position, you can contact Morten Rufus Blas, Head of FCP Advanced Analytics, at morten-rufus.blas@seb.se.  

  

We look forward to hearing from you!

**Learn more about working at** **SEBwww.sebgroup.com/career***It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe, or where they come from.*
company_description: More than 15.000 people work at SEB. Working in SEB means being part of an exciting journey, driven by digital transformation

title: Systemutvecklare .NET / Java Automotive
description:
Jobbeskrivning


Är du en passionerad utvecklare med siktet inställt på innovativa lösningar och hållbar teknik? Då kan AFRY Digital Services vara din perfekta arbetsplats! Vi söker nu erfarna konsulter till våra kunder inom fordonsindustrin i Mälardalen.


I den här rollen får du:

* Använda din expertis som utvecklare för att skapa avancerade system som formar framtidens fordon.
* Samarbeta med likasinnade i team präglade av gemenskap och kunskapsutbyte.
* Lösa komplexa problem i en varierande och kommunikativ miljö.
* Bidra till en hållbar framtid genom innovativa teknologier.


#systemutvecklare #fordonsindustri #AFRY #hållbarteknik #framtidensfordon #.NET #C# #Java


Kvalifikationer


Vi söker dig som:

* Har minst 5 års erfarenhet av systemutveckling i Java och/eller C# / .NET.
* Gillar att skriva kod och samarbeta för att skapa nya lösningar.
* Behärskar svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


Ett plus i kanten om du:

* Har arbetslivserfarenhet från fordonsindustrin och dess utmaningar.
* Har erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt.
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta med molntekniker som till exempel Azure och AWS.


Är du redo att ta din utvecklingskunskap till nästa nivå? Sök tjänsten idag och bli en del av vårt team som driver fordonsindustrin framåt!

AFRY är en europeisk ledare inom ingenjörs-, design- och rådgivningstjänster med global räckvidd. Vi påskyndar omställningen mot ett hållbart samhälle. Vi är 19 000 hängivna experter inom infrastruktur, industri, energi och digitalisering, som skapar hållbara lösningar för kommande generationer.


Vår enhet Digital Services verkar över hela utvecklingskedjan med experter inom projektledning, kravanalys, QA och test, systemutveckling, arkitektur, dataanalys och AI, cybersäkerhet m.m.


Ytterligare information

* Ett stort nätverk av kompetenta kollegor i Sverige och internationellt.


Varmt välkommen till oss!

You will be part of a global and diverse company where our differences are our strengths. Join us to accelerate the transition towards a sustainable society.*

Vi söker konstant kvalificerade kandidater som vill ansluta sig till våra inkluderande team runt om i världen. Bli en del av oss och påskynda den gröna omställningen*

title: Middle+ Level Designer
Website Developer Intern
description:
**Job Title:** Website Developer Intern


**Company**: Landell Games


**Location:** Remote


**Duration:** 6 Months (Unpaid Internship but valuable)



**About Us:**



At Landell Games are passionate about creating immersive and engaging gaming experiences. We are currently in the development phase of our websites for both Apoceus and Landell Games, and we are looking for a dedicated and enthusiastic Website Developer Intern to join our team. This is a fantastic opportunity to gain hands-on experience and contribute to exciting projects.



**Role Overview:**



As a Website Developer Intern, you will play a key role in continuing the development of our websites. You will work closely with our design and development teams to create user-friendly and visually appealing websites using React. This is an ideal role for someone looking to gain practical experience in web development.



**Key Responsibilities:**


* Collaborate with the design team to implement website layouts and features.
* Develop responsive and dynamic websites using React.
* Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs.
* Optimize website performance and ensure fast loading times.
* Assist in debugging and resolving technical issues.
* Participate in team meetings and contribute ideas for website improvements.

**Requirements:**


* Basic understanding of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
* Familiarity with React and its core principles.
* Ability to convert design mockups into functional web pages.
* Knowledge of responsive design principles.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Good communication skills.

**Nice to Have:**


* Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git).
* Basic understanding of SEO principles.
* Familiarity with web performance optimization techniques.
* Knowledge of modern front-end build pipelines and tools.

**What We Offer:**


* Hands-on experience working on real-world projects.
* Opportunity to work with a passionate and creative team.
* Mentorship and guidance from our current crew.
* Flexible work hours.
* Remote work opportunity.
* Recommendation certificate after completion
* Share your work in your profile

Join us at Landell Games and take the first step towards a rewarding career in web development!


  
Landell Games
Ruotsi
Kokopäiväinen

title: Application Specialist
description:
**Do you want to join the LS Central team in the** **Onboard Sales & Service** **Digital department, as our new Application Specialist?** The team is responsible for the development of digital products related to tills, ordering, replenishment etc. onboard Stena Line’s fleet. We are delivering innovative commercial experiences through one of Stena Line’s biggest revenue streams, in the core business application Dynamics 365 Business Central/LS Central.  

  

As Application Specialist you are part of an agile cross-functional scrum team which is responsible for developing and delivering the Microsoft Business Central/LS Central application, according to its roadmap and prioritized product backlog. Together with your team consisting of application specialists, developers and architects you plan, design, develop, test and maintain the BC/LS application in accordance with established processes. You are also encouraged to analyze Stena Line’s business processes and recommend ways to improve these for maximum business value.  

  

Some of your key responsibilities:  

* Configure, enhance and maintain the Dynamics 365 Business Central and LS Retail application
* Maintain the dialogue with Product Owner and business and recommend ways to improve for maximum business value
* Analyze and resolve technical and application problems
* Support developers in troubleshooting and debugging the BC/LS application
* Occasionally, travel with vessels to deploy, train and support onboard teams regarding releases and enhancements
* Prepare reports, manuals and other documentation on the functionality and maintenance of the NAV/LS application
* Support new initiatives within the Onboard experience organization

  

**What you will experience**  

We offer you a job opportunity in a kind, open-minded and motivated team that links system expertise and technology to the customer experience. Our customers are application users as well as customers visiting our onboard shops and restaurants.  

  

As a Stena Line employee in Sweden, we offer you an additional benefits package consisting of travel discounts, health allowance, well-being activities, access to a benefits portal, and much more.  

  

We believe a hybrid solution between the office and working remotely will create the best environment for us to be creative, productive and find a work-life balance creating magic today and tomorrow.  

  

**Who you are**  

At Stena Line your personality matters as much as how good you are at what you do. Regardless of your role, welcoming, caring and reliable guides you in your everyday work and the challenges you face.  

  

We believe you are positive and have passion for sharing your knowledge to others. With your personality you contribute to the team spirit and a nice working environment.  

  

You are engaged, know how to collaborate to achieve a common goal and you enjoy cross functional teamwork. Taking ownership and responsibility for your team and its product you actively contribute to our success.  

  

We also believe you are driven by delivering value to the business and to create results. An innovative mindset, readiness to challenge the status quo, and the ability to adapt quickly are essential traits in this role.  

  

Qualifications:  

* University degree in Computer Science, System Science (IT) or similar
* Experience in setting up/maintaining Dynamics 365 Business Central
* Proficiency in English, written and spoken

  

Meritorious:  

* Experience in the LS Central application
* Previous operational experience in the retail/hospitality industry

  

**Interested?**  

This is a full-time, permanent position based in Gothenburg within our Transformation department. To apply, please register your profile and send in your application in English as soon as possible but no later than 16th of June 2024. We are having an ongoing selection, so do not wait with your application. Please note that due to GDPR we do not accept applications via e-mail or postal service. We have collective bargaining agreements with Unionen, among others, who you can contact for more information.  

  

If you have any questions regarding the position, feel free to contact People and Technology Manager Hannes Pinkenburg, hannes.pinkenburg@stenaline.com or about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact Frida Berntsson, Talent Acquisition Partner, frida.berntsson@stenaline.com.  

  

**About Stena Line**  

As a leader in sustainable shipping, Stena Line has Europe’s most comprehensive route network focusing on transportation of both passengers and freight. We have over 6,100 employees in our Stena Line family across Scandinavia, around the UK and the Baltics, making a contribution to our company.  

  

Stena Line exists to be a trusted link between people, places and societies. We play a vital role in keeping everything connected. We make sure people and goods arrive where they need to be, enabling business to thrive and societies to grow. We connect family and friends and make it possible to explore new destinations or revisit favorite places.  

  

We are committed to maintaining and developing a sustainable working environment, free from harassment, that gives equal opportunities to everyone. We embrace equality, diversity and inclusion – and welcome all applicants.
company_description: We are one of the world’s largest ferry companies. We exist to be a trusted link between people, places and societies. Everything we do is based on our core values passion, sustainability and care.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
### **Want to Join Frends Growth Journey to the leading eiPaaS in the Nordics and Europe?**

 **Do you have an interest** in learning how to implement integration solutions **using** **Frends eiPaaS?** Do you have several years of experience through work in the **back end,** and do **databases** interest you? Do you enjoy solving the technical challenges of different customers and dare to challenge them? Can you visit our Stockholm office on a weekly/monthly basis and speak fluent Swedish?


If you answer Yes, contact us on a low threshold, and let's discuss more - no need for CV´s or cover letters.


*”On the integration side, interfaces and technologies are constantly evolving and changing, which means that you can constantly explore and learn new things and deepen your skills.”* -Integration Developer, Frends.

**➡️**

### **We offer you**

* **a competitive salary adequate to your expertise** **50-63K SEK**
* interesting and **challenging projects** in different fields
* the opportunity to further develop and **expand your skills**
* an employer who supports in various life situations
* **flexible** **work mode**
* **safe and stable workplace**
* skilled co-workers and supportive supervisor
* low hierarchy, and a flexible and relaxed organizational culture
* wide employee benefits


 Top workmates coupled with challenging and versatile projects with a powerful platform that enables digitalization and process automation – that’s**Frendszone.** Strong team spirit as well as trust, freedom, and flexibility, are the cornerstones of our culture.

#### **Frends**

**The product you will be working on** and with is our very own in-house solution Frends iPaaS which is developed initially in Finland. It´s a low-code, hybrid integration platform with its roots spanning back three decades. So the product is not in its very early stages and certainly not stuck in the 90's - it has been and is constantly being developed. The latest incarnation of the product utilizes modern technologies and cloud services. Frends is based on C# and runs on Azure.


Frends will help you deliver integration features and automate business processes of our customers. With us you get to see the development of the modern enterprise iPaaS platform from various angles.

 **➡️ Read more what it's like to develop integrations with Frends iPaaS** from our blog which includes a demo-video and watch our webinar. Want to learn more about Frends? You can go through our free learning path "L0 Getting Started" in Frends Academy and see what Frends is all about.

 **In our work, you will get to use also** Azure's various technologies, such as Machine Learning and Data Factory. The magic words for success are REST, JSON, XML, XSLT, and SQL. In addition, knowledge of API architectures, API Management, GraphQL, and LINQ are things we value - which you'll also get to learn.

  

If you don’t meet all of the checkpoints, don’t worry. If you believe that you’re the right person for us, we might just believe that as well. Get in touch, and let´s discuss more!

* **Interested to join Frends?**

 **If this piqued your interest, we hope to hear from you!**

  

We do not expect excellent CVs or application letters, but we hope you will contact us via our application form or by emailing Robert, Frends Head of Delivery in Sweden: robert.bansell@frends.com.


The start is flexible according to your situation.


The role requires good **English and fluent Swedish and living in Sweden.** Our office is in Stockholm (Katarinavägen), so we request to visit the office on a weekly/monthly basis.

**➡️**

#### **Want to know more about Frends?**

**Frends eiPaaS**isour own, Nordic, modern, low-code integration platform. Frends solves the digitalization challenges of both global and smaller customers and in both private and public sectors in various industries. As a brand Frends is over 30 years old but the recent rise of iPaaS Frends has seen explosive growth in the Nordic and Europe markets. It has been and is constantly being developed by our own R&D team. The latest incarnation of the product utilizes modern technologies and cloud services.

**Frends is recognized in the** **Gartner*****®*** **Magic Quadrant™** for Integration Platform as a Service, Worldwide. Frends was also awarded in G2 review with the "Fastest Implementation" badge in 2023.

  

Visit our webpage. Check out our use cases. Listen to our webinars.

title: Integrationsutvecklare
description:
### **Vill du delta i Frends satsning att bli marknadsledande eiPaaS?**


Den nordiska integrationsplattformen **Frends** växer och vi förstärker vårt team i Sverige med utvecklare som gillar integrationer och kommunikation.

* **Om nedan passar in på dig, tveka inte att kontakta oss så vi kan diskutera mer.**
* Fascineras du av system och **integrationer** inom och mellan företag?
* Har du förståelse och erfarenhet av **IT-system** och olika sätt att integrera dessa?
* Trivs du med flöden, **utveckling**, dataformat, SQL, APIer och Webhooks?
* Klurar du på **automation**, datahantering, maskininlärning och artificiell intelligens?
* Gillar du att både vara med från ax till limpa, och att **djupdyka** i tekniska detaljer?
* Vill du knyta ihop allt detta och implementera integrationslösningar med **Frends**?


Du är handlingskraftig och **självgående**, där du klarar allt från att hantera kunder och svåra problemställningar till att mejsla fram lämplig **arkitektur**, samt utveckla och konfigurera kompletta lösningar. Där allt handlar om att på bästa sätt hjälpa våra kunder att **lyckas** integrera system och data med hjälp av **Frend**s eiPaaS.  

  



*”Inom integration utvecklas och förändras gränssnitten och teknologierna kontinuerligt, vilket betyder att du ständigt kan utforska och lära dig nya saker och fördjupa din kompetens.”* *– Integrationsutvecklare, Frends.*


### **Hörnstenarna i vår arbetskultur är en stark laganda, tillit, frihet och flexibilitet - Vi kallar det Frendszone.**


Tänk att du blir landsatt på en öde ö mitt i natten, det är becksvart och du vet ingenting om läget eller vad din uppgift egentligen är - förutom att åstadkomma hjältedåd. Du måste skaffa dig en god överblick, ta fram en plan och lösning - till din hjälp har du ett verktyg - **Frends**.


Såklart händer det också att vi har en vanlig dag på kontoret, med kaffe och teamwork. Men du, ha alltid ditt överlevnadskit nära till hands...  

Och tänk på att Frends och kollegor alltid stöttar dig både i arbetslivet och olika livssituationer.

#### **Vi erbjuder**

* en konkurrenskraftig lön som motsvarar din expertis **(45-63K SEK)**
* intressanta och utmanande projekt, möjligheten att vidareutvecklas
* en arbetsgivare som stöttar dig i olika livssituationer, låg hierarki, flexibel och avslappnad organisationskultur.


➡️ **Läs mer om** det dagliga arbetet på vår **blogg**.

####  **Känner du igen dig och är intresserad av att jobba hos Frends?**


Vill du delta i Frends satsning att bli ledande eiPaaS i Norden, Europa och globalt? Då hoppas vi att du kontaktar oss via ansökningsformuläret eller mejlar Robert, Head of Delivery i Sverige: robert.bansell@frends.com.


Positionen kräver flytande **svenska** och engelska och att **du bor i Sverige** **med fokus på kontoret i Stockholm** i det här fallet (besöker kontoret vecko-/månadsvis).

#### **Vill du veta mer om Frends?**

**Frends eiPaaS** är vår egen, nordiska, moderna low-code integrationsplattform som möter digitaliseringsutmaningar för såväl globala som mindre **kunder****,** både inom privat och offentlig sektor. Som varumärke har Frends funnits i över 30 år och med den senaste tidens uppgång för iPaaS har Frends fått en explosiv tillväxt i Norden och Europa, samt växande närvaro globalt. Den senaste versionen av produkten bygger på modern teknologi och molntjänster och vidareutvecklas kontinuerligt av vårt R&D team.


➡️ **Läs mer om att utveckla integrationer med Frends** iPaaS på vår **blogg**, där det också finns en demovideo, och kolla våra **webbsändningar**. Du kan ta vår gratis kurs **Frends Fundamentals - Getting Started** i Frends Academy och se vad Frends egentligen handlar om.  

  



Frends eiPaaS erkänns också av Gartners ledande analytiker och är med i **Gartner® Magic** **Quadrant™****,** bland världens mest framstående integrationsplattformar. **Frends** belönades i **G2** review med "Fastest Implementation" emblem år 2023.  

  



Besök vår **webbplats**, kolla våra **användningsfall** och lyssna på våra **webbsändningar**. Läs mer om **Frendszone** i våra blogginlägg.

title: Global Program Manager at DeLaval (8583)
description:
*Are you a senior leader with business perspective and a passion for creating efficient teams? Can you easily change perspective from stake holder demand to hands on problem solving? Do you enjoy a dynamic and global multi-cultural environment and know how to make things happen to secure project deliveries on time and according to targets?*  


*Then you could be our next senior program manager, playing a key role for the global change towards sustainable food production by driving the development of high technology products for dairy farmers.*  


**Global Program Manager at DeLaval** **Global** **Project Management Office**
As a Program Manager at Delaval, you play a central role in ensuring the success of business-critical programs and projects by effectively managing resources, risks, and stakeholders. You will lead, plan, and execute the program together with the project managers for the different projects in the program and a cross-functional program core team. The main task is to ensure that the program achieves its objectives within specified time and cost frames while delivering high quality results.  

**Your responsibilities include**:
* Strategic Program Planning

Establishing goals and plans, securing the program expected benefit and business case.
* Stakeholder Collaboration

Manage relationships and communications with stakeholders, including upper management, team members, design, supply chain, and market, ensuring transparency and involvement.
* Team Leadership and Collaboration


Build efficient program team, provide direction, and open communication to achieve objectives efficiently.
* Program Execution


Lead the planning, execution, and delivery of the program, as well as managing dependencies and risk efficiently.  

**Your Profile**
We believe you are a senior leader with many years of experience of project management for product development projects and programs. You have experience from hardware and software development and are familiar with both agile and traditional product development from early stages through industrialisation.
We also see that you have a master’s degree in industrial engineering or equivalent and have experience running large-scale, multi-site product development projects as well as multi-project steering.  

  

To be successful in this role, we see that you:
* Are skilled in leading other leaders in an inclusive and efficient manner.
* Have excellent communication and intercultural collaboration skills.
* Are strong in navigating in efficient ways in all levels and parts of the organisation.
* Have a high degree of strategic business acumen and strong customer-orientation.

  


**What We Offer**
We offer you a workplace like no other, where state-of-the-art technology goes hand in hand with animal welfare, as well as with employee work-life balance.
You will report directly to DeLaval PMO Director and be part of the Project Office Management team, having the possibility to contribute to the direction of the PMO and the development of project management at DeLaval.
Location: Tumba, Sweden.  

**Working at DeLaval**
Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. DeLaval is a global leading developer, manufacturer, and supplier of solutions for dairy farmers around the world. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions.  

**For further information, please contact:**Global PMO Director, Product Development, Ellinor Berg, ellinor.berg@delaval.com
HR Business Partner Elin Fagerstedt, elin.fagerstedt@delaval.com  

Please apply with your CV and a personal letter describing how you can contribute to this role. Last day to apply is June 16th, 2024, and interviews will be held ongoing. Please apply in this system by using the “apply here” button.
See more at corporate.delaval.com
